titleStmt.title: Who Chooses a Horse Harran
SHAWI Corpus

monogr.title: A Digital Dictionary of Shawi Arabic

prefixDef.p: Private URIs using the teiCorpusHeader prefix are pointers to any element in the SHAWI teiCorpus document.
Private URIs using the share prefix are pointers to audio file residing on the SHAWI network share.
Private URIs using the geo prefix are pointers to the xml:id attribute on a place element in VICAV Geodata list.
Private URIs using the zotid prefix are pointers to the xml:id attribute on a biblStruct element in the TEI export of the VICAV Zotero Group library.
Private URIs using the dict prefix are pointers to the xml:id attribute on a entry in the SHAWI glossary.
Private URIs using the rend prefix are pointers to the xml:id attribute on a rendition element in VICAV rendition library.
Private URIs using the assets prefix are pointers to the location of the SHAWI media assets.

spanGrp.span: Master Stephan, once upon a time there was a big sheikh in Turkey, a well-known one, his whole environment was nice.
As for this sheikh, he had three wives, he had taken three women.
One day he said, “I want to go to my uncle in Syria.” He had an uncle, the brother of his father.
Let’s say, he wanted to visit his older paternal uncle. He mounted a horse, thingy, his horse, and together with his men he travelled to Syria.
He went to Syria and arrived at his uncles. That one had thoroughbred horses, the courtyard was full of about hundred horses, all thoroughbred mares.
When he entered, (his uncle said), “Welcome, welcome to the son of my brother!” He welcomed him, let them sit down and served them lunch. They ate their meal.
He said, “(Serving) The guest is your obligation.” So, the host took his guest around and showed him this and that.
He also took him to the thoroughbred horses and said; “These ones are mine. O son of my brother, go inside the paddock, to the horses!
If you like one of them, it should be yours as a present! I bestow you one from those I have. Go inside, choose one you like and this one will be yours.”
Tsk! His brother’s son went inside, chose one, looked and said, “O uncle, I want this one.”
His uncle looked at it like this and said, “O son of my brother. As for this one, better leave it. But if you want it, take it!”
He said, “Uncle, why should I leave this one? Didn’t you say, ‘The one you like, take it!’ And I like this one. Why don’t you give it to me?”

He said, “O son of my brother, again I keep my word and I will give it to you. However, this one’s aunt, when it carried its rider and when they came to a watercourse it threw him down into the channel when he wanted to jump over it.
It took its rider and threw him down into the water. I am afraid that if it comes after its aunt and if you will take this one, when seeing water, it may also throw you down into the water.
Therefore, I am telling you leave this one! However, otherwise I will keep my word. Take it if you want it. It’s yours!”
He said, “Uncle, my heart desires this one, I really want it.” He said, “Okay! Take it!” And he took it.
Two or three days later, a week later when he went back to his family, they came from Syria to Turkey at Tell Abyad. And there is a water channel, there is water.
He wanted to jump over the water but when he reached the channel: loop! (His horse) threw him down into the water.
When it had thrown him into the water he became dirty from the water and cleaned himself.
He called his men and said, “Come to me! I want to tell you something.” – “O sheikh, at your command.’ It is said that

his third wife, we say üçüncü for ‘third’ in Turkish, his third wife’s grandmother was one who had left her parents and wanted to marry against the will of her family. Do you know what xāṭfe means? – Yes, I know it.
He said, “Before we reach Urfa, my brothers, be my witnesses that hereby I have divorced my third wife so-and-so daughter of so-and-so.

At this place here I tell you, “Be my witnesses that she has been divorced and I will divorce her (in person) when I go there. But I have already divorced her at this place here; I do not like her anymore.”
They said, “We are your witnesses, o sheikh. For what we have seen and for what we have heard. Alright!”
After he had cleaned himself he mounted his horse and arrived home. When he came back home, how come, only two of his wives greeted him and welcomed him saying, “Welcome back to the sheikh!”
How come? Where is the third one? He said, “The what’s her name, where is she?”
They said, “By God, two days ago she disappeared and went away. We don’t know about her.
Maybe she disappeared because she went to her former fiancé. We don’t know but she left you and went away.”
He said, “See? My uncle gave me a hint but I did not get it.”
He said to me, “Don’t take this one because her aunt threw its rider down into the water.”

This was a warning for me. My third wife’s grandmother was one who had left her parents and wanted to marry against the will of her family. Therefore, I divorced her. It was good that I had divorced her.” Enjoy it!
